title: Carmencita
plot: Performing on what looks like a small wooden stage, wearing a dress with a hoop skirt and white high-heeled pumps, Carmencita does a dance with kicks and twirls, a smile always on her face.::<jhailey@hotmail.com>, Presumably, the first woman ever to appear in a Kinetoscope film and possibly the first woman to take part in a motion picture in the United States, the Spaniard dancer, Carmencita, performs her appealing high-kick dance in front of the camera of William K.L. Dickson and William Heise, for Thomas Edison. In this segment of her New York music-hall act, she spins and twirls, exhibiting an admirable talent, a fashionable dress, and a really charming smile.::Nick Riganas

title: Le clown et ses chiens
plot: Short film of 300 individually painted images.::pablo323

title: Pauvre Pierrot
plot: One night, Arlequin come to see his lover Colombine. But then Pierrot knocks at the door and Colombine and Arlequin hide. Pierrot starts singing but Arlequin scares him and the poor man goes away.::Tetsuo Aminata

title: Blacksmith Scene
plot: Three men hammer on an anvil and pass a bottle of beer around.::Anonymous, A stationary camera looks at a large anvil with a blacksmith behind it and one on either side. The smith in the middle draws a heated metal rod from the fire, places it on the anvil, and all three begin a rhythmic hammering. After several blows, the metal goes back in the fire. One smith pulls out a bottle of beer, and they each take a swig. Then, out comes the glowing metal and the hammering resumes.::<jhailey@hotmail.com>

title: Corbett and Courtney Before the Kinetograph
plot: James J. Corbett and Peter Courtney meet in a boxing exhibition.::Snow Leopard, James J. Corbett and Peter Courtney meet in a boxing exhibition, with special conditions that will allow the Thomas Edison Company to film the match and show it on their Kinetograph. The match consists of six one-minute rounds. The popular James J. Corbett had earlier defeated the great John L. Sullivan and must be considered a heavy favourite. But, at least for a while, Peter Courtney seems to be holding his own.::Snow Leopard

title: Edison Kinetoscopic Record of a Sneeze
plot: A man (Thomas Edison's assistant) takes a pinch of snuff and sneezes. This is one of the earliest Thomas Edison films and was the first motion picture to be copyrighted in the United States.::Eric Sorensen <Eric_Sorensen@fc.mcps.k12.md.us>, A man (Edison's assistant) takes a pinch of snuff and sneezes. This is one of the earliest Edison films and was the first motion picture to be copyrighted in the United States.::Eric Sorensen <Eric_Sorensen@fc.mcps.k12.md.us>

title: Miss Jerry
plot: The adventures of a female reporter in the 1890s.::Anonymous, Geraldine (Jerry) Holbrook, a girl of Eastern birth, decides to start a career in journalism in the heart of New York, after she feels that her father is close to a financial crush. In the process she falls in love with the editor of her paper, Mr. Hamilton. After the first successful article, she leads Hamilton into doubting her love for him, and this makes him accept a job in London. But his worries prove wrong when Jerry accepts to marry him and leave to London.::Ion Martea
